column4: I receive this error when I put my flash drive in my notebook: "Error mounting: mount exited with exit code 1: helper failed with:
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sdb1,
missing codepage or helper program, or other error
In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
dmesg | tail  or so"
what should I do?
reads like your flash drive's filesystem is unreadable to Ubuntu.
what FS do you have it, and does it work elsewhere?
sorry I'm not sure what FS means.
Filesystem. "fat", "ntfs", "hfs+", "ext3" are all filesystems.
I believe its fat
does it work on other systems?
by "work", I mean "did you try it since it stopped working in ubuntu".
yes it does. It works on both windows and mac machines
odd.
when I ran 8.04 it just said it couldn't mount. I figured 10.04 might have fixed the problem I was having
At least now it tells you what's wrong :) Is this a U3 or some other "non-normal" flash drive? Do other flash drives work on the same computer?
I'll try my other flash drive. I thought i got ride of U3 on the flash drive
I get the same message with my Kingston flash drive
odd. no idea.
ok thanks
